snippet: Iran released another political prisoner, and Israel’s prime minister slipped into Persian to suggest that only “sadeloh,” or “dupes,” would be fooled by the nation’s recent diplomatic overtures.
abstract: Iran released another political prisoner, and Israel’s prime minister slipped into Persian to suggest that only “sadeloh,” or “dupes,” would be fooled by the nation’s recent diplomatic overtures.

headline.main: Iran Frees Another Reformer, but Netanyahu Warns Iranians, in Persian, Not to Be 'Dupes'
